New Records: Tarik Skubal became the fourth Detroit left-hander with 200 strikeouts in a season.
Key Match Events: Tarik Skubal pitched eight innings and struck out eight batters.
Tyler O’Neill hit a first-inning homer for the Red Sox.
Spencer Torkelson hit a one-out single and Zach McKinstry extended his hitting streak to a career-best 11 games with a double.
Trey Sweeney hit a fly ball to left field that drove in two runs with a double.
Tyler Holton pitched the ninth for his sixth save.
Ryan Kreidler made a jump throw from foul territory to retire Triston Casas.
Post-Match Reflections: Tarik Skubal expressed that it was fitting to pitch deep into the game on the night the Tigers celebrated their 1984 World Series championship.
Tigers manager A.J. Hinch praised Skubal's performance and consistency throughout the season.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora acknowledged Skubal's talent and emphasized the need for the Red Sox to win the next game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers celebrated their 1984 World Series championship with a ceremonial first pitch by Jack Morris to Lance Parrish.
The Tigers moved within 1 1/2 games of Boston for fourth in the American League wild-card race.
Rich Hill, the only player on either roster born when the Tigers last won the World Series, picked off Parker Meadows at first base.
